intro: Glycosmis calcicola var. kelantanica, commonly known as the Kelantan gooseberry, is a rare shrub native to the limestone hills of Malaysia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green berries that mature to a reddish hue. The plant thrives in calcareous soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly aromatic scent. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
